<!-- audit-pr-docs -->

## ❌ Audit PR Docs

**Last updated:** 2026-02-21 10:20:25 PT

Found 1 violation across 1 file. Inline comment posted.

### Patterns Checked
✅ Verbatim source code copies — None found
❌ Inaccurate claims — Found in `docs/learned/ci/test-coverage-detection.md:9`
✅ Drift risk sections — None found
✅ Duplicative sections — None found

### Violations Summary
- `docs/learned/ci/test-coverage-detection.md:9`: Inaccurate — tripwire warning still says `packages/*/tests/` is searched, but the review spec only searches `tests/**/`. The table below was correctly fixed but the tripwire text was not updated.

### Files Reviewed
- `docs/learned/ci/automated-review-system.md`: 0 violations (review bots table uses stable file paths; re-review triggers section is HIGH VALUE; bot thread inflation section cross-references appropriately)
- `docs/learned/ci/index.md`: 0 violations (index-only change)
- `docs/learned/ci/test-coverage-detection.md`: 1 violation (tripwire text still contains inaccurate `packages/*/tests/` reference — inline comment posted on line 9)
- `docs/learned/ci/tripwires.md`: 0 violations (additive tripwire entries)
- `docs/learned/erk/graphite-divergence-detection.md`: 0 violations (guard chain pseudo-code is not verbatim source; bash gt commands are CLI usage — permitted exception; effective_force note is accurate per source verification; HIGH VALUE architectural decision doc)
- `docs/learned/erk/index.md`: 0 violations (index-only change)
- `docs/learned/erk/pr-address-workflows.md`: 0 violations (Operational Procedures section uses CLI invocation examples — permitted exception; Review Thread vs Discussion Comment distinction is HIGH VALUE)
- `docs/learned/erk/tripwires.md`: 0 violations (additive tripwire entries)
- `docs/learned/planning/draft-pr-branch-sync.md`: 0 violations (Pattern Consistency section uses source pointers correctly; PR #7697 context is HIGH VALUE)
- `docs/learned/planning/draft-pr-lifecycle.md`: 0 violations (body format blocks are data format examples — permitted exception; False Match Prevention section uses source pointer correctly; asymmetric search description is HIGH VALUE)
- `docs/learned/planning/impl-context.md`: 0 violations (Worker-Impl Cleanup section uses source pointer format correctly; Deferred Impl-Context Deletion section quotes doc comment — not verbatim source code)
- `docs/learned/planning/index.md`: 0 violations (index-only change)
- `docs/learned/planning/learn-plan-metadata-fields.md`: 0 violations (field naming clarification table is HIGH VALUE cross-cutting insight; anti-pattern code blocks correctly marked WRONG — permitted exception)
- `docs/learned/planning/next-steps-output.md`: 0 violations (property tables document command output interface — permitted exception per source-pointers.md; verified against next_steps.py source; all property values accurate)
- `docs/learned/planning/tripwires.md`: 0 violations (additive tripwire entries)
- `docs/learned/pr-operations/draft-pr-handling.md`: 0 violations (Troubleshooting section uses cross-references; source pointers used correctly; no verbatim source)
- `docs/learned/pr-operations/pr-validation-rules.md`: 0 violations (source pointers with correct format; Backend-Specific Validation uses line references for config files — appropriate per source-pointers.md)
- `docs/learned/tripwires-index.md`: 0 violations (auto-generated count updates)

---

### Activity Log
- **2026-02-21 10:20:25 PT**: Re-audit: 1 remaining violation in test-coverage-detection.md — tripwire warning (line 9) still mentions `packages/*/tests/` despite the table below being correctly fixed. All 17 other files clean.
- **2026-02-21 10:08:09 PT**: Re-audit after PR addressing: 1 pre-existing violation in test-coverage-detection.md remains open (dual test locations table). All other 17 files clean. No new violations introduced by latest commits.
- **2026-02-21 05:55:13 PT**: Found 1 violation in test-coverage-detection.md: inaccurate dual test locations table claims packages/erk-shared/tests is searched, but review spec only searches tests/
- **2026-02-21 05:43:40 PT**: Found 3 violations across 3 files: 1 inaccurate claim (graphite auto-force behavior undocumented), 2 drift risks (authority level table not source-backed; call-site diff table too implementation-specific)
- **2026-02-21 05:08:47 PT**: Found 2 violations across 2 files (verbatim block in impl-context.md; inaccuracy in next-steps-output.md)

Updated the IssueNextSteps table in next-steps-output.md to show the correct commands from source: prepare now shows `erk br create --for-plan {issue_number}` and prepare_and_implement shows `source "$(erk br create --for-plan {issue_number} --script)" && erk implement --dangerous`.
